concept_data.title: three-presidency team
concept_data.category_name: EU institutions and European civil service
concept_data.category_full: 1006 EU institutions and European civil service

summary: The "three-presidency team," more commonly referred to as the "Presidency trio," represents a collaborative framework within the European Union's institutional structure. This concept involves a trio of member states that preside over the Council of the European Union for an 18-month period, rotating every six months. Each presidency is tasked with setting the agenda, facilitating dialogue among member states, and driving legislative initiatives. The Presidency trio aims to ensure continuity and coherence in the EU's policy-making processes, enhancing the effectiveness of the Council's operations. This collaborative approach underscores the importance of collective leadership in EU governance.
